required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Montelukast Back to School Asthma Study (0476-340)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-Controlled Parallel Group 8-week Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Chewable Montelukast When Initiated at the Start of the School Year in Pediatric Patients With Chronic Asthma

brief_summary.textblock: This study, in children with chronic asthma, evaluates the number of days of worsening asthma during 8 weeks of treatment with montelukast after treatment is started for the first day of school.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Percentage of Days With Worsening Asthma (as Measured on Daily Diaries) in Pediatric Asthmatic Participants
primary_outcome.time_frame: 8 Week treatment period initiated at the beginning of a school year
primary_outcome.description: A day of worsening asthma is a day with: increase from baseline in β-agonist use (> 70% and a min increase of 2 puffs); > 50% increase from baseline in daytime symptoms score; awake "all night"; increase from baseline in inhaled corticosteroid use ≥ 100% or oral corticosteroid rescue for worsening asthma; or unanticipated healthcare utilization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With the Occurrence of One or More Health Care Utilizations (as Measured on Daily Diaries)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 Week treatment period initiated at the beginning of a school year
secondary_outcome.description: Health care utilization is defined as unanticipated asthma care in an office or clinic, emergent or hospital setting.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Days With Increased β-agonist Use by >70% and a Minimum Increase of 2 Puffs From Baseline (as Measured on Daily Diaries) in Pediatric Asthmatic Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 Week treatment period initiated at the beginning of a school year

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Days With Increased Daytime Asthma Symptom Score by >50% From Baseline (as Measured on Daily Diaries) in Pediatric Asthmatic Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 Week treatment period initiated at the beginning of a school year
secondary_outcome.description: Daytime asthma symptom score was calculated as the sum of the responses (0 (best) to 5 (worst)) to three daytime symptom questions.

intervention.description: montelukast 5 mg tablet Once a day (QD) for 8 weeks
Placebo to montelukast QD for 8 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female non-smoking Participants, ages 6 to 14 years, with chronic asthma, history of at least one asthma exacerbation associated with a cold within the past year and a documented history of asthma that required treatment with any asthma medication within 6 months prior to Visit 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant cannot have any other acute or chronic pulmonary disorder, or hospitalization for asthma more than three times within one year prior to signing informed consent

link.description: MedWatch - FDA maintained medical product safety Information
Merck: Patient & Caregiver U.S. Product Web Site

reference.citation: Weiss KB, Gern JE, Johnston NW, Sears MR, Jones CA, Jia G, Watkins MW, Smugar SS, Edelman JM, Grant EN. The Back to School asthma study: the effect of montelukast on asthma burden when initiated prophylactically at the start of the school year. Ann Allergy Asthma Immunol. 2010 Aug;105(2):174-81. doi: 10.1016/j.anai.2010.04.018. Epub 2010 Jul 1.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were randomized at 165 sites in the US and Canada. Therapy period: June to November 2006 (including screening period).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants who were hospitalized for asthma in the 4 weeks prior to randomization or who required excluded medications were excluded from randomization.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Montelukast matching-image placebo tablet taken orally once daily at bedtime for 8 weeks.

group.title: Montelukast 5 mg
group.description: Montelukast 5 mg chewable tablet taken orally once daily (OD) at bedtime for 8 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Montelukast matching-image placebo tablet taken orally once daily at bedtime for 8 weeks.

group.title: Montelukast 5 mg
group.description: Montelukast 5 mg chewable tablet taken orally once daily (OD) at bedtime for 8 weeks.

measure.title: Daytime Asthma Symptom Score
measure.description: The Participant or parent/guardian scored his/her/child's symptoms [from 0 (best) to 5 (worst)] on a daily basis. Scores were entered into a Participant diary during the 2-week period prior to the start of the study drug.

measure.title: β-Agonist Use
measure.description: The number of puffs used per day was entered by the Participant or parent/guardian into a Participant diary during the 2-week period prior to the start of the study drug.

outcome.title: Mean Percentage of Days With Worsening Asthma (as Measured on Daily Diaries) in Pediatric Asthmatic Participants
outcome.description: A day of worsening asthma is a day with: increase from baseline in β-agonist use (> 70% and a min increase of 2 puffs); > 50% increase from baseline in daytime symptoms score; awake "all night"; increase from baseline in inhaled corticosteroid use ≥ 100% or oral corticosteroid rescue for worsening asthma; or unanticipated healthcare utilization.
outcome.time_frame: 8 Week treatment period initiated at the beginning of a school year
outcome.population: The primary efficacy analysis was based on full-analysis-set (FAS) population. This included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of double-blinded therapy and had a valid efficacy measurement. The percent of worsening asthma days was calculated from at least 7 days of diary data. Missing diary data were not imputed.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Montelukast matching-image placebo tablet taken orally once daily at bedtime for 8 weeks.

group.title: Montelukast 5 mg
group.description: Montelukast 5 mg chewable tablet taken orally once daily (OD) at bedtime for 8 weeks.

measure.title: Mean Percentage of Days With Worsening Asthma (as Measured on Daily Diaries) in Pediatric Asthmatic Participants
measure.description: A day of worsening asthma is a day with: increase from baseline in β-agonist use (> 70% and a min increase of 2 puffs); > 50% increase from baseline in daytime symptoms score; awake "all night"; increase from baseline in inhaled corticosteroid use ≥ 100% or oral corticosteroid rescue for worsening asthma; or unanticipated healthcare utilization.
measure.population: The primary efficacy analysis was based on full-analysis-set (FAS) population. This included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of double-blinded therapy and had a valid efficacy measurement. The percent of worsening asthma days was calculated from at least 7 days of diary data. Missing diary data were not imputed.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With the Occurrence of One or More Health Care Utilizations (as Measured on Daily Diaries)
outcome.description: Health care utilization is defined as unanticipated asthma care in an office or clinic, emergent or hospital setting.
outcome.time_frame: 8 Week treatment period initiated at the beginning of a school year
outcome.population: The analysis was based on the FAS population. This included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had a valid efficacy measurement. Occurrence of one or more health care utilization was derived from the available diary data and was set to missing if no diary data were available.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Montelukast matching-image placebo tablet taken orally once daily at bedtime for 8 weeks.

group.title: Montelukast 5 mg
group.description: Montelukast 5 mg chewable tablet taken orally once daily (OD) at bedtime for 8 weeks.

measure.title: Number of Participants With the Occurrence of One or More Health Care Utilizations (as Measured on Daily Diaries)
measure.description: Health care utilization is defined as unanticipated asthma care in an office or clinic, emergent or hospital setting.
measure.population: The analysis was based on the FAS population. This included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had a valid efficacy measurement. Occurrence of one or more health care utilization was derived from the available diary data and was set to missing if no diary data were available.

class.title: Participants not requiring Health Care Utilization

outcome.title: Percentage of Days With Increased β-agonist Use by >70% and a Minimum Increase of 2 Puffs From Baseline (as Measured on Daily Diaries) in Pediatric Asthmatic Participants
outcome.time_frame: 8 Week treatment period initiated at the beginning of a school year
outcome.population: The secondary efficacy analysis was based on full-analysis-set (FAS) population. This included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of double-blinded therapy and had valid efficacy measurement for at least 7 days of diary data.

group.description: Montelukast matching-image placebo tablet taken orally once daily at bedtime for 8 weeks.

group.title: Montelukast 5 mg
group.description: Montelukast 5 mg chewable tablet taken orally once daily (OD) at bedtime for 8 weeks.

measure.title: Percentage of Days With Increased β-agonist Use by >70% and a Minimum Increase of 2 Puffs From Baseline (as Measured on Daily Diaries) in Pediatric Asthmatic Participants
measure.population: The secondary efficacy analysis was based on full-analysis-set (FAS) population. This included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of double-blinded therapy and had valid efficacy measurement for at least 7 days of diary data.

outcome.title: Percentage of Days With Increased Daytime Asthma Symptom Score by >50% From Baseline (as Measured on Daily Diaries) in Pediatric Asthmatic Participants
outcome.description: Daytime asthma symptom score was calculated as the sum of the responses (0 (best) to 5 (worst)) to three daytime symptom questions.
outcome.time_frame: 8 Week treatment period initiated at the beginning of a school year
outcome.population: The secondary efficacy analysis was based on full-analysis-set (FAS) population. This included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of double-blinded therapy and had a valid efficacy measurement. Variables that were measured as the average over the treatment period were defined from at least 7 days of evaluable diary data.

group.description: Montelukast 5 mg chewable tablet taken orally once daily (OD) at bedtime for 8 weeks.

measure.title: Percentage of Days With Increased Daytime Asthma Symptom Score by >50% From Baseline (as Measured on Daily Diaries) in Pediatric Asthmatic Participants
measure.description: Daytime asthma symptom score was calculated as the sum of the responses (0 (best) to 5 (worst)) to three daytime symptom questions.
measure.population: The secondary efficacy analysis was based on full-analysis-set (FAS) population. This included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of double-blinded therapy and had a valid efficacy measurement. Variables that were measured as the average over the treatment period were defined from at least 7 days of evaluable diary data.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected during the 8 week, double-blind treatment period, and up to and including 14 days after the last dose of study therapy
reported_events.desc: The number of participants listed in the AE tables (566 placebo & 566 montelukast) is the number that received treatment. 16 placebo & 14 montelukast randomized participants did not receive treatment. Although a participant may have 2 or more AEs they are counted only once in a category. The same participant may appear in other categories.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Montelukast matching-image placebo tablet taken orally once daily at bedtime for 8 weeks.

group.description: Montelukast 5 mg chewable tablet taken orally once daily (OD) at bedtime for 8 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
